subject: Critical Thinking
title: The Spotlight Effect: Nobody's Watching
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Spotlight Effect: Nobody's Watching.

hook.text: You spill coffee on your shirt and feel everyone notices. A study showed only 25% of people even registered the stain.

buildup.text: The spotlight effect: we vastly overestimate how much others notice our appearance, actions, and mistakes.

discovery.text: Gilovich et al. (2000) had students wear embarrassing t-shirts. Students thought 50% noticed â€” actually ~23% did.

twist.text: This applies to good things too â€” we overestimate how much others notice our clever remarks or new haircuts.

climax.text: Everyone is too busy worrying about their own spotlight to notice yours. It's a shared delusion.

punchline.text: You're not the main character in anyone else's story.

quiz.question: What is the spotlight effect?
options: Overestimating how much others notice and judge us
